title: Meet the retired oil exec plugging forgotten wells to reduce emissions

options.label: A
options.text: Wells that are properly sealed and plugged after use.

options.label: B
options.text: Wells that are left unsealed and abandoned after use.

options.label: C
options.text: Wells that are used for experimental purposes.

options.label: D
options.text: Wells that are used for recreational activities.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, how many orphan oil and gas wells are estimated to be across America?

options.label: B
options.text: 1 million

options.label: C
options.text: 2 million

options.label: D
options.text: 3 million

multiple-choice.question: What is the problem with orphan wells?

options.label: A
options.text: They leak oil and salt, contaminating groundwater.

options.label: B
options.text: They leak methane, which is 84 times more potent than CO2.

options.label: C
options.text: They leak carcinogenic gases, which can be deadly.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

multiple-choice.question: Who is responsible for cleaning up the mess of orphan wells?

options.label: A
options.text: The oil and gas industry.

options.label: B
options.text: The government.

options.label: C
options.text: The states.

options.label: D
options.text: It's a collective responsibility.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Well Done Foundation doing to address the problem of orphan wells?

options.label: A
options.text: They are drilling new wells.

options.label: B
options.text: They are plugging orphan wells.

options.label: C
options.text: They are conducting research on the issue.

options.label: D
options.text: They are advocating for policy change.

multiple-choice.question: How much can it cost to plug a well?

options.label: B
options.text: $30,000 to $1 million.

options.label: C
options.text: $1 million to $5 million.

options.label: D
options.text: $5 million to $10 million.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Regrow Act, and what does it aim to do?

options.label: A
options.text: It aims to increase oil and gas production.

options.label: B
options.text: It aims to reduce the number of orphan wells.

options.label: C
options.text: It aims to provide funding for well plugging.

options.label: D
options.text: It aims to ban the use of oil and gas.

multiple-choice.question: How much funding was earmarked for well plugging under the Regrow Act?

options.label: A
options.text: $1 billion.

options.label: B
options.text: $2 billion.

options.label: C
options.text: $4.7 billion.

options.label: D
options.text: $10 billion.

multiple-choice.question: What is Bubbleology, and what does it do?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a company that drills new wells.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a company that plugs orphan wells.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a company that measures air pollution.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a company that conducts research on the issue.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the Regrow Act, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a step in the right direction, but more needs to be done.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a comprehensive solution to the problem.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a temporary fix that will not address the underlying issue.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a complete failure that will not achieve its goals.
